title: The Web Developer Bootcamp (Colt Steele @Udemy.com)
description: This was the first developer course I took, though I had some HTML knowledge prior to this course. I learned CSS, basic *Javascript*, *JQuery*, *Bootstrap*, *Express* and more. It made me really enthusiastic about programming.

title: React - The Complete Guide (Maximilian Schwarzm√ºller @Udemy.com)
description: I heard about this thing *React* and wanted to know what is was and what it did. Through this course I learned about *components* (both class and functional), *hooks*, *front-end* *routing*, *state* *management*, and more. It made me understand the core concepts.

title: MERN Stack Front To Back: Full Stack React, Redux and Node.js
description: This course consisted mainly of building a social media application (called DevConnector). Starting out with the backend API, creating protected routes, and then moving on to the front-end (React). Very challenging, I learned a lot.

title: Vue JS - The Complete Guide (incl. Vue Router and Vuex)
description: I learned about Vue directives, components, data binding, front-end routing. Basically all the things i learned in React, but in a different form. The best aspect of Vue I think is the usage of directives, which makes your code clean and readable (whereas in React you use JSX, it can get messy).

title: Next.js and React - The Complete Guide
description: This course showed me why Next.js is such a popular framework. I learned about Server Side Rendering (SSR), Static Site Generation (SSG), and Incremental Static Site Regeneration (ISSR). I found out that Next.js is really SEO-friendly. You can even write back-end express-like API routes with Next. It's like building a front-end and back-end application in one framework!

title: CODAM
description: I will propably start a 2 year education at Codam in Amsterdam in august 2022. I will provide more information here later.
